titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert Dardano papers, 1985-2017 MS2165
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-05-18 14:32:43 -0400.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.abstract: Collection contains minutes, correspondence, flyers, candidate questionnaires, brochures, and other material. The material dates from 1985-2017. The material was collected by Robert Dardano in the course of his membership and active participation in the Gay and Lesbian Activists Alliance and the Gertrude Stein Democratic Club. Dardano was involved with the election committees of both organizations, and the collection reflects that involvement, as well as his own personal political files. Of particular interest are questionnaires which were sent to candidates in location and national elections.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Robert Dardano papers, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Robert Dardano in 2001 and added to in 2011, 2017, 2019, 2020 and 2021.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Robert Dardano was active in several gay and lesbian civil rights organizations, including the Gay and Lesbian Activists Alliance, the Gertrude Stein Democratic Club, and the Domestic Partnership Coalition. He lived in Washington, D.C. and worked for the Library of Congress.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains minutes, correspondence, flyers, publications, posters, candidate questionnaires, brochures, and other material. The material dates from 1985-2017. The material was collected by Robert Dardano in the course of his membership and active participation in the Gay and Lesbian Activists Alliance, the Gertrude Stein Democratic Club and the Domestic Partnership Coalition. Dardano was involved with the election committees of both organizations, and the collection reflects that involvement. Of particular interest are questionnaires which were sent to candidates in location and national elections. The collection includes the questionnaires, the candidate responses, related correspondence, and materials related to the subsequent endorsement or ranking of the candidates. There are also the files related to Dardano's campaign for DC Democratic State Committee.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: Organized into 4 series: Gay and Lesbian Activisists Alliance, Gertrude Stein Democratic Club, Political files, and Publications and posters.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Most of the folder titles were created by archivists during processing and reflect the content within the folders.

Gay rights
Elections
Lesbians -- Washington (D.C.)
Gay men -- Washington (D.C.)
controlaccess.corpname: Gay and Lesbian Activists Alliance (Washington, D.C.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains minutes, correspondence, flyers, candidate questionnaires, brochures, and other material collected by Dardano in the course of his membership in the Gay and Lesbian Activists Alliance (GLAA). The material ranges in date from 1986-1999. The bulk of the series consists of GLAA agenda and minutes, and documents relating to Washington, D.C. City Council, Mayor, and School Board elections. These documents include questionnaires (and draft questionnaires) sent to candidates on subjects relating to gay and lesbian rights and other issues, the candidate responses, and any related correspondence. In many cases, the questionnaires are annotated with comments by GLAA members. The questionnaires were used to rank candidates for endorsement by GLAA. The series also includes flyers and mailings promoting events sponsored by GLAA and other organizations, newsletters, clippings, and other material.

did.unittitle: Elections--1991 School Board and City Council
Elections--1995 Special Election for Ward 8 City Council Seat
News Clippings National March for Gay Rights
GLAA Congressional Anti-LGBT Discrimination in D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains minutes, correspondence, flyers, candidate questionnaires, brochures, and other material collected by Dardano in the course of his membership in the Gertrude Stein Democratic Club (GSDC). The material ranges in date from 1987-2010. The bulk of the series consists of GSCD agenda and minutes, and documents relating to national and local (Washington, D.C.) elections. These documents include questionnaires sent to candidates on subjects relating to gay and lesbian rights and other issues, the candidate responses, and related correspondence and notes. The questionnaires were used to rank candidates for endorsement by GSDC. The series also includes candidate literature, flyers and mailings promoting events sponsored by GLAA and other organizations, newsletters, clippings, and other material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence, flyers, press releases, campaign materials, newspaper articles, and other material collected by Dardano. These items were filed separately from the materials of the Gertrude Stein Democratic Club, and reflect Dardano's personal political files. This series also includes Dardano's files from the Ward 6 Democrats' Club. There are also files related to Dardano's campaign for DC Democratic State Committee. As well as a small number of records for the Domestic Partnership Coalition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: this file contains campaign materials including fliers, meeting minutes, election results for Jim Zais' run for DC Council in 1991 for the vacant Ward 2 seat

relatedmaterial.head: Related materials
relatedmaterial.p: Madeline Davis archive at SUNY Buffalo State: Finding Aid contains resources about Jim Zais.

There are also photographs of Jim at the 1971 March on Albany for Gay Rights in the New York Public Library digital collection as part of the Diana Davies collection (the photographer who took the photos): Diana Davies photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains LGBT focused publications and posters. The materials date from 2007-2015.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by publication title with posters after the publications.
